name: Castex Hotel

reviews.text: The Castex is small, tidy, and has character without being pretentious. The Castex, unbelievably, is on a quiet street just 2 blocks from the Bastille which is normally quite active with restaurants, cafes, shops, nightlife, and cars. The hotel is also on the edge of the Marais, so it's a short walk to the features in that area, too. The price was average for the area. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are pleasantly, if simply, decorated. The bathroom was of good size. The windows were double-glazed. I was on the back side of the hotel, so it was really quiet. The view was toward other buildings, but as there was the tiny courtyard below, it wasn't claustrophic. The room had individual climate control. The staff on the desk were all pleasant, though my interaction was rather limited, not being a first time traveler to Paris. The elevator was big enough for 2 or 3 people with luggage. The biggest plus of all was free wireless internet access. The other hotels I looked into around there in that class all charged heinous fees for wi-fi. My only two negatives are 1) though the bed was comfy, the mattress was slumping and due for replacement and 2) there was a mildew smell from the bathroom. I think the problem was poor ventilation and there's probably not a good fix for that. Anyway, with the door closed, it wasn't a bother.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in an excellent location

likes.disliked: — mildew smell from bathroom, mattress due for replacement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say, having read tons of reviews of Paris hotels, is that what most people fail to note about central Paris is that so many of the hotels are buildings that were converted or were hotels long before people came to expect huge American-style room spaces. You can find those large rooms, but be prepared to pay for them. If you are going to go on a low budget, you will normally get a small room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel. Excellent location a few minutes walk from the metro station (Bastille).
reviews.title: decent hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — decor/furnishings a bit stale, bungled check-in

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine, but no chocolate croissants :( For the money you can get a better experience at one of the nearby cafes.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Castex
Always a pleasant stay
reviews.text: Our room (on the top floor) was quite small, but clean, warm, and comfortable.

The Castex Hotel is charming and absolutely stunning! Rooms are full of character and are more comfortable than we expected; the beds and shower were better than mine at home! The only suggestions for improvement would be to have a bit more information available in the room about the area and directions, as well as an alarm clock. The breakfast is convenient, but nothing special so not really worth the price. That being said, the Castex made my stay in Paris truly enjoyable and if I ever go back I will not hesitate to book there again.
reviews.title: Enchanting Castex

likes.liked: — The beauty and comfort of the room; the shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great find! Nice hotel in a great location at a very reasonable price. The hotel was clean and cozy, with impecccable service. The breakfast was good - baguettes, croissants, jams, cheese, fruit, cereal, juice, coffee, tea, and yogurts - plenty to get you started for a day of sightseeing. It normally costs 10Euro/day, but be sure to get your free breakfast with a Rick Steves book. This saved us 20 Euros a day! Also, the price I got on their website was quite a bit less than their posted double rate. We had a double for 110 Euros (and with free breakfasts b/c we had the Steves book).
reviews.title: Warm, cozy, French, with great location and value

reviews.text: We visited in December, so the fireplace in the main room made for a nice place to hang out, play card, read the paper. There is also a computer for internet in the lobby. The hotel offers free wireless, but the service did go out a few times during the 5 days we were there.
reviews.title: Tres Bon 3-Star Hotel in The Marais

reviews.text: The hotel is a very short walk from the Bastille metro stop (less than 2 minute walk). We were also able to walk from the Gare de Lyon station (where the Air France bus from the airport stops) to the hotel easily (about 10 minutes), but you could also take the metro. The cafe at the corner of Rue Castex and Rue St. Antoine was also great and convenient.
reviews.title: I've Stayed Here Twice Now

reviews.text: Le Marais is my favorite part of Paris, and I always try to stay there when I visit. That can be a challenge, as there are not many good, affordable hotels right in the Marais. My most recent Marais stay was at Hotel Castex, and I was very pleased with it. It's a solid three-star property with comfortable rooms, great location, and good prices. I paid about 115 euros/night for a double-bed (the usual-for-France two single beds pushed and sheeted together) room that I booked directly on the hotel's easy-to-use website.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel, fabulous location!

reviews.text: I found this hotel through Trip advisor and it was great. I booked a single room and was pleasently surprised at its size. You could comfortably sleep 2 in the room and it was very clean. Also, its location was great: 2 minute walk to the metro and tons of cafes, restaurants and shops in the Marais area.
reviews.title: Loved Castex

likes.liked: — good value for the price and the great locations

reviews.title: Great Little Hotel
reviews.text: I would definitely go there again in the future.

After checking out Trip Advisor etc, we decided to stay at the Castex Hotel ,which ended up being a great little place, and in a fantatstic location, close to the Metro, Night life, and good walking distance to all the tourist attractions. Room was fine but small....typical Paris, but clean and great shower and bed ...all in all, very happy with our stay ...oh yeah and friendly staff!!
reviews.title: Great Location and Good Price!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Castex on a Rick Steves group tour. I arrived a day before the tour started and the hotel staff could not have been nicer. They were very accommodating and I was able to check in a little before the posted check-in time.
reviews.title: Beautiful

likes.disliked: — Front room was a little noisy early in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in a first floor room at the front of the building but since this is a quiet street, noise was not a factor.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Hotel Castex

likes.liked: — The location was great and our room was of ample size.
likes.disliked: — You could hear the people above us walking around and running water.

reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Castex; March 2 - March 7, 2005. I agree that the outside is nothing special but inside is quaint, spotless and more than adequate. We had room 305 - yes small but this is expected in Paris. The room was tastefully decorated, ample closet space, in room safe and comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless and very up to date. Maid service was excellent. Staff were friendly as required but not intrusive. The breakfast for 10 Euros is a average. We only did that once. It was much better and more economical to eat at a local cafe. Still it is a plus to have the option of eating at the hotel especially on departure day.
reviews.title: Exactly what we expected - just fine.
Good hotel in a great area
reviews.text: I stayed at the Castex in February '05 with my boyfriend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice location, friendly staff, good access to the Metro but tended not to use too often anyway as the walk into the City was lovely anyway. Thought the hotel in general was good value, though rooms are small (but who cares when your only there for a few days), only problem I encountered was some traffic noise in room but nothing too unpleasant.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: This hotel is located in a great part of the city right next to the Bastille. It is also a short walk to the trendy area around the Hotel de Ville. Convient, safe, great cafes around the place, relaxing and charming area.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel! Great price and location!
We highly recommend the Castex Hotel
reviews.text: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel de charme. The location was excellent (Marais); the staff were exceedingly helpful; the bathroom was spacious, modern, and spotless; and the price very reasonable, especially for such a wonderful neighborhood. We highly recommend the Castex Hotel.
My three sons ( ages 15, 19, and 23) and I enjoyed our rooms and the neighborhood. The location is great and the staff were very helpful. We hope we can stay there again soon.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Castex hotel several times over the past decade. The combination of good rates, great service, and top, top location makes this our choice of stay in Paris again and again.
reviews.title: Home in the Marais

reviews.text: An excellent location. It was a Saturday when I checked in, and was transiting from New Delhi to Brussles for a tax conference, hence stayed at Castex for a day. The receptionist was quite friendly and helpful (I had to bother her atleast three times in one hour to know where I could get an adaptor for my laptop, a place to eat and nearest metro etc.).The hotel is well kept - I got a (single) room at the top floor, with a spacious shower, though the room itself was small (and the view was non existent), to say the least, cramped- but then, I had come prepared for that- after all, its Paris! The metro is hardly a minute's walk, so are eating joints (what variety!!), pubs and the like. Overall, an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: First time in Paris...!

likes.disliked: — Room was too small for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been waiting to see Paris all my life (I am 46). Even though my husband and I only had a weekend, Hotel Castex was above and beyond what I could have hoped for. They let us check in and drop our bags off in the morning which freed us up to see ALL the sights in pretty much one day. We were tired, but they also helped recommend a lovely restaurant (unfortunately it was already booked for the evening) and hailed us a cab just in time to see the Eiffel Tower lights at 11:00 pm.
reviews.title: LIved Up to Expectations

likes.liked: — It had all the French elements I was looking for
likes.disliked: — bathrrom shower was not well organized/ water leaked onto floor

reviews.text: We stayed at the Castex Hotel on Rue Castex October 15-22, 2006. It is located 1 block from the Bastille Metro Station which makes getting around the city of Paris a breeze. There is also a Post Office across the street where you can purchase stamps and mail postcards to friends and family back home which was really convenient! The hotel itself is nothing fancy and although the rooms are small, they are extremely clean and provide a large, deep soaking bathtub.
reviews.title: Great Location, Staff, and Rooms!

reviews.text: The staff was incredibly polite and helpful with directions and they offer free internet service to all guests. If you mention Rick Steve's Guide Book, you can receive Free Continental Breakfast each morning that consists of Croissants, Cereal, Toast, Coffee, Juice, and Yogurt.
reviews.title: Perfect location, helpful staff and we got a reallly large room...

likes.disliked: — That it was hard to find (for the taxi driver)

reviews.text: If you have never travelled to Paris before, I highly recommend that you learn the Metro system and purchase a 5-day metro ticket rather than taking a taxi anywhere in the city. The system is so convenient and will take you anywhere you want to go quickly and reliably. **Word of caution**, be VERY aware of your wallets and purses as the Gypsies can spot a tourist a mile away and are bold and fast. 2 of our travel companions with purses caught the girls (yes, they were young teenage girls!) with their hands inside their purses quicker than lightening, but thankfully they didn't get anything and stepped off the train just before the doors closed.
reviews.title: Good location, Small Rooms

likes.disliked: — small size of rooms and price

reviews.text: Also, when you exit the Metro Station, try and remember to make sure that you enter and exit on the same street. Almost every Metro station has multiple exits(Including Bastille which is in a circle!) and you can get turned around very easily if you aren't paying attention! We made sure to notice landmarks like statues after getting turned around 1 too many times! :-)Also be sure to have a very good map of the city and streets to help navigate and guide you everywhere.
reviews.title: Connecting Rooms/Buffet Breakfast/RickSteve Discount

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Feel free to contact me directly with any additional questions or recommendations at liaschmoldt@mchsi.com . Paris is the most amazing city and you will definitely have a memorable and amazing vacation there! I hope this review helped in your decision! Bon Voyage!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

likes.disliked: — book early, news will spead about this nice place

reviews.text: We chose the Castex based entirely on reviews on this site. What a fantastic place! From the consistently helpful and friendly staff (offered us an umbrella when we were about to go out in the rain, and asked the cab driver how much the fair would be to the airport before they let him take our luggage) to the immaculately clean room, the place was just great. And the location couldn't really be better. When you go out the door, make a right, and your a few blocks from the Ile de St. Louis. Make a left, and your at the Bastille and the Marais. Good A/C too, although it was so mild out, that we slept with the window open instead. On a 3-week trip to Europe, we stayed at many nice hotels. This one was far and away the best of the trip!
reviews.title: So much better than expected!!

reviews.text: One other thing - yes, the room is small. But they've clearly put thought into maximizing the limited space. The result is a small room that feels much larger than it actually is. Bottom line; we go to Paris a lot, and this is the only hotel we're staying at from now on!
reviews.title: Just a so-so hotel

description: This three star hotel is located right in the heart of the Marais. With its Louis XIII furniture and style, it has retained its 17th century character, the golden age of this district.Charm and originality blend with elegance, thanks to a subtle mix of wood panelling and wrought iron.Your stay in our hotel is sure to be a marvellous experience, because we know that when you travel, you hope to feel like you’re at home, if not even better.
